instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A usb frying devices
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that [I]works[/I] minus two pretty big issues. 

Issue 1: When I plug in my charger or my flash drives, things work great independently. When I plug in my flash drive [I]and[/I] charger together, it fries my flash drive and sends 20v straight to the drive (already fried 3 drives before realizing this happened). Could this be an issue with <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>?

Issue 2: Right side usb ports don't work at all (I'm guessing <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is fried on the right side?)

Is issue #1 something you've seen before, and is there someplace I should look? Am I on the right track for issue #2? I haven't taken the logic board out yet since this is my primary laptop, but wanted to get a consult before I start replacing things.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A usb frying devices
threads.message:
Dual input MOSFET (aka <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>/etc) is shorted.
Is the reason to fry USB devices.
Be sure USB hub is still good now.
